text: buenos dias from El Salvador my hundred
and six countries I was surprised how
simple it was to get here Avianca has a
quick two hour flight nonstop from
Houston for 120 bucks boom I arrived in
the undiscovered capital of San Salvador
without any plans
my friend Eduardo from Salvador and
tourist was kind enough to pick us up at
the airport and guide us around for a
few days I saw and learned a lot about
El Salvador during my short visit and I
can certainly say that this country
doesn't get nearly the attention it
deserves
here are six things you should know
about El Salvador one it's a smallest
country in Central America smaller than
Massachusetts and it's home to 6.5
million people making it the most
densely populated country in all the
Americas - it's safer than the news says
everything I heard about El Salvador
before my trip revolved around crime and
danger many people on Instagram told me
not to go well guess what I'm walking
around Sen Salvador and everything feels
pretty safe every country has good and
bad people but as long as you have
common sense like don't wander alone at
night then you'll be just fine
oh and I three the national dishes
pupusas we are about to eat pupusas
which is the most famous dish in el
salvador it's a thick rice or corn
tortilla stuffed with cheese peppers
onions and other ingredients then
fizzled over a fire and served piping
hot it's my favorite food in Latin
America but don't forget about the other
amazing food in El Salvador like the
fresh fruit fish and oh yeah locally
grown coffee for Salvadoran people are
extremely warm friendly and happy
despite 19 percent of them living on
less than a dollar 25 per day we visited
some villages in the countryside and I
saw nothing but smiling faces and open
arms 5 el salvador is a land of the
volcanoes hundreds yes hundreds of
volcanoes here we're hiking to volcano
right now more than 20 of them being
active lava vicuna backyard lava the
surrounding nature and wildlife is
breathtaking 6 it's affordable I found a
Salvador to be one of the cheapest
countries in Latin America they also use
US dollars which is convenient and easy
I hope you enjoyed my tour of El
Salvador and that you feel inspired to
visit this lovely country I'm drew
pinsky and if you like my travel videos
please click Subscribe and join me as I
plan to visit every country in the world
